content: around note always move working yarn to front and leave hanging in front of work at the end of every round to secure final yarn over while you work the cc round cc round *sl1yo brp* around leave cc yarn hanging to front of work at the end of every round main pattern mc round move mc yarn to back *brk yf sl1yo* around cc round *sl1yo brp* around repeat mc and cc rnds 20 times when counting row in brioche count mc stitches on front of work as a round every mc and cc round counts as a single round since you work half of your stitches in the mc then work the other half in the cc bind off with mc k1 *k1 sb2 k2tog tbl* repeat until all stitches are bound off break yarn weave in ends tip for hiding ends using your tapestry needle weave the yarn tail in by closely following the path of your worked stitches of the same color for the very tip of the yarn tail try to twist it together with the stitch you have been following to secure it contact cassondra rizzardi@gmail com 5 instagram @rizzaknits
